Html:
Hi, 

I would like a way of sending multiple parameters when commanding, I have a command setup as follows:

 

<Button Grid.Column="3" x:Name="gwConnectionBarButton"
                        Content="{Binding ButtonContent, Mode=TwoWay, UpdateSourceTrigger=PropertyChanged}"
                        commands:Click.Command="{Binding ConnectionBarClickCommand}"
                        commands:Click.CommandParameter="{Binding ElementName=gwConnectionBarButton,Path=Content}" 
                        Click="gwConnectionBarButton_Click" />

which is sending in the Button content, this is useful to me but what I really want to receive is the value of 3 text boxes that exists within the same View as this button, what woudl be the best way to go about this?

Many thanks, Mark

Please ignore this, although i'm sure there will be cases when this may be of use to me its not right now.

Afetr a quick read of http://blogs.southworks.net/dschenkelman/ I realised I could achieve the same results with some binding between the TextBox's and my ViewModel.

 

Many Thanks, Mark
